decks.notes: The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan with a combination of disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Force of Will, while simultaneously deploying threats like Murktide Regent and Kaito, Bane of Nightmares to apply pressure and close out the game quickly. The deck also utilizes cards like Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student and Baleful Strix to generate card advantage and maintain tempo. The mana base is designed to support the deck's aggressive game plan with a mix of fetch lands and dual lands, along with utility lands like Wasteland to disrupt the opponent's mana base.

The deck aims to quickly and efficiently mill through the entire library, using creatures like Boggart Trawler and Balustrade Spy to dump all creatures into the graveyard. Thassa's Oracle is then used to win the game by having no cards left in the library. The deck is designed to win on the first turn or early in the game using a combination of fast mana acceleration, card draw, and protection spells like Pact of Negation. The focus is on assembling the combo pieces and executing the win condition as quickly as possible.

The deck focuses on early disruption with cards like Fatal Push and Thoughtseize, while also applying pressure with aggressive creatures like Barrowgoyf and Murktide Regent. It aims to control the board using counterspells like Force of Will and Daze, while also utilizing tempo plays with cards like Brazen Borrower and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student. The deck also includes efficient removal spells like Snuff Out and Orcish Bowmasters to deal with opposing threats. The mana base is streamlined and focuses on maximizing the efficiency of the deck's spells.

The main focus of this UWx Control deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan through a mix of counterspells, hand disruption, and removal spells. The deck also aims to control the board with creatures like Orcish Bowmasters and utility cards like Sheoldred's Edict. Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student provides card advantage and Snapcaster Mage allows for the reuse of powerful spells. The deck has a diverse mana base to support its three-color identity and includes powerful threats like Murktide Regent and Kaito, Bane of Nightmares to close out the game.

This Eldrazi Aggro deck aims to put aggressive pressure on the opponent by playing powerful Eldrazi creatures that can come down quickly and disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck utilizes cards like Thought-Knot Seer and Reality Smasher to control the board and disrupt the opponent's hand, while also using mana acceleration cards like Grim Monolith and Lotus Petal to cast its threats ahead of schedule. Additionally, cards like Wasteland and Chalice of the Void help disrupt the opponent's mana base and spells, allowing the deck to maintain its aggressive tempo and dominate the battlefield.

The main focus of the deck is to quickly and efficiently combo off by milling the entire library and winning the game through a mixture of cards like Balustrade Spy, Undercity Informer, and Dread Return. By utilizing cards like Cabal Therapy, Thoughtseize, and Unmask to disrupt the opponent's strategy and protect your own combo pieces, along with employing acceleration like Lotus Petal and Simian Spirit Guide, you aim to overwhelm the opponent before they have a chance to stop you. The deck is all about fast, all-in combo plays and not holding back.

This deck aims to quickly mill the entire library, utilizing cards like Balustrade Spy and Undercity Informer to put all cards into the graveyard. Once the library is empty, Thassa's Oracle is used to win the game. The combo requires a careful balance of mana acceleration and protection spells like Pact of Negation, while also using tools like Cabal Therapy to disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck is focused on executing its game plan efficiently and effectively, with little room for error or deviation.

The deck focuses on controlling the game through counterspells like Force of Will and disruptive spells like Daze, while also utilizing various removal spells such as Swords to Plowshares and Prismatic Ending. Stoneforge Mystic is used to search for powerful equipment like Kaldra Compleat and Meteor Sword to enhance creatures. Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student and other card draw spells like Ponder and Brainstorm help maintain card advantage. The deck also includes utility lands like Karakas and Wasteland to disrupt the opponent's game plan. Overall, the deck aims to control the game through a combination of disruption, removal, and card advantage.

This deck focuses on utilizing a combination of artifacts and aggressive creatures to overwhelm the opponent quickly. By using cards like Urza's Saga and Emry, Lurker of the Loch to generate value and fast mana sources like Ancient Tomb and Lotus Petal, the deck aims to establish a dominant board presence early on. The inclusion of disruptive spells like Force of Will and Mystical Dispute helps protect the deck's game plan while cards like Pinnacle Emissary and Kappa Cannoneer provide additional threats to pressure the opponent.

The main concept of this deck is to generate mana quickly using cards like Dark Ritual, Chrome Mox, and Mox Opal, while disrupting the opponent's hand with cards like Duress and Thoughtseize. The deck aims to assemble a win condition by using cards like Infernal Tutor and Burning Wish to find key combo pieces like Tendrils of Agony or Ad Nauseam. This combo-focused strategy is supported by cards like Wishclaw Talisman and Urza's Saga to tutor for specific pieces, creating a powerful storm deck that can overwhelm opponents with a flurry of spells.

The deck is centered around assembling and executing the Doomsday combo using cards like Thoughtseize, Doomsday, Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student, and Thassa's Oracle. It aims to set up a winning game state by manipulating the top of the library and utilizing cards like Lotus Petal and Lion's Eye Diamond for mana acceleration. The deck also includes disruption elements like Force of Will and Daze to protect the combo. The inclusion of cards like Murktide Regent and Jace, Wielder of Mysteries provide alternate win conditions in case the primary combo plan is disrupted.

This deck focuses on playing aggressive creatures quickly and utilizing powerful mana acceleration to gain an early advantage over opponents. By disrupting the opponent's mana base with cards like Wasteland and Trinisphere, while also providing protection with Chancellor of the Annex and Anointed Peacekeeper, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent before they can stabilize. With Seasoned Dungeoneer and Caves of Chaos Adventurer providing card advantage, this deck aims to maintain pressure and keep the opponent on the back foot throughout the game.

The main concept of this Combo-Dredge deck is to quickly fill the graveyard with cards like Golgari Grave-Troll and Stinkweed Imp, then use cards like Bridge from Below and Narcomoeba to generate tokens, eventually using Dread Return to bring back powerful creatures like Ox of Agonas. Otherworldly Gaze helps to manipulate the top of the library, while cards like Cabal Therapy provide disruption for the opponent. This deck aims to overwhelm the opponent by utilizing the graveyard as a resource to create a winning board state.

This deck focuses on aggressive play by utilizing powerful dragon creatures and disruptive cards like Blood Moon, Chalice of the Void, and Magus of the Moon to control the board. The deck aims to quickly ramp up mana production with City of Traitors and Ancient Tomb to cast threats like Broadside Bombardiers and Pyrogoyf early in the game. Urza's Saga provides additional utility by searching for key artifacts like Soul-Guide Lantern and The One Ring. Overall, the deck's strategy revolves around overwhelming the opponent with efficient creatures and disruptive spells.

The main idea of this Bant Control deck is to utilize powerful control spells, card draw, and efficient creatures to outvalue and outlast opponents. With a mix of counterspells like Force of Will and Leyline Binding, removal like Swords to Plowshares, and card advantage engines like Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student and Brainstorm, the deck aims to control the board and stabilize the game. The deck also includes ramp in the form of Up the Beanstalk and big threats like Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd to close out the game. Additionally, the deck features a versatile sideboard to adapt to various matchups.

This Dimir Tempo deck focuses on maintaining control of the board with disruptive spells like Daze, Thoughtseize, and Fatal Push while applying pressure with efficient creatures like Orcish Bowmasters and Murktide Regent. The deck also utilizes powerful tempo plays with cards like Brazen Borrower and Kaito, Bane of Nightmares to disrupt the opponent's game plan. By combining disruption with aggression, this deck aims to quickly outpace and overwhelm opponents while manipulating the game to its advantage.
